Articles.Content:
I see a merchandising opportunity here. http://www.amazon.com/Cleaner-Laptops-Phones-Keyboards-Office/dp/B00D6Y7SPM

It comes in green and other colors. Have the manufacturer put it in KSP Mystery Goo packaging...

Back in the 40s, while looking for a substitute for natural rubber, silly putty was invented.

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Silly_putty

Later, there was Flubber, then Green Slime from the Ghostbuster's movie.

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Slime_%28toy%29
You could also manufacture that glow-in-the-dark slime that is used in freshmen chemistry courses, and call that mystery goo.

Much less legal hassle to just have some other company alter the packaging of a product they're already manufacturing than to cook up some goop to sell. Squad is a software company, not a manufacturer of products.

BTW, those goops really do clean keyboards, or at least soften the gunge to where it'll wipe off.
But authentic Mystery Goo comes from dumpster diving

Back in the 40s, while looking for a substitute for natural rubber, silly putty was invented.

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Silly_putty

also found was the base used in older sticks of gum.
Ok, I need that. For cleaning my dismally-neglected keyboard.
